intro: Crumenaria choretroides var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy crumenaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
